# helpers.lapply { #pyLHD.helpers.lapply }

`helpers.lapply(lst, func, **kwargs)`

Apply a function to each item in a list

## Parameters

| Name     | Type                 | Description                                                                     | Default    |
|----------|----------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------|
| `lst`    | List\[Any\]          | List of elements to which the function will be applied                          | _required_ |
| `func`   | Callable\[..., Any\] | The function to apply. It can be a built-in function or a user-defined function | _required_ |
| `kwargs` | dict\[str, Any\]     | Additional keyword arguments to pass to the function                            | `{}`       |

## Returns

| Type        | Description                                                                        |
|-------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| List\[Any\] | List[Any]: A list containing the results of applying `func` to each item in `lst`. |

## Examples




```{python}
import pyLHD
l = [[1,2],[3,5], [3,1]]
pyLHD.lapply(l, func = min)
```
